page.title: 01LAND USE
page.content: This land is almost entirely composed of moorland.This is too boggy for grazing animals, and enclosed fields are used to contain them. There are many streams and these are surrounded by marshland.The soil is sponge like and this holds water, other mosses and grasses have grown over the top and these are dangerous. The highest point on the map is on the Chains, highest point 1599 ft. above sea level.The Chains are very boggy, and its many streams form into rivers. The main rivers are the Barle, West Lyn, Hoar Oak and the Exe. There is a complete lack of settlement in the Chains and only two desolate farms exist in this area.One is now deserted the other is an exploration centre.
